## Best JS libraries for animation?


![Wow.js](data:image/jpeg;base64,){: .centImg}

[WOW.js](http://mynameismatthieu.com/WOW/)

“Reveal Animations When You Scroll. Very Animate.css Friend :-) 
Easily customize animation settings: style, delay, length, offset, iterations…”

and

```countUp.js```

[countUp.js](https://inorganik.github.io/countUp.js/)

“CountUp.js is a dependency-free, lightweight JavaScript "class" that can be used to quickly create animations that display numerical data in a more interesting way.”

and 

![type.js](https://github.com/mattboldt/typed.js/raw/master/logo-cropped.png){: .centImg}

[Type.js](http://www.mattboldt.com/demos/typed-js/)
“Typed.js is a jQuery plugin that types. Enter in any string, and watch it type at the speed you've set, backspace what it's typed, and begin a new sentence for however many strings you've set.


[View the live demo](http://www.mattboldt.com/demos/typed-js/) | [Go to my site, mattboldt.com](http://www.mattboldt.com) “

Use [ScrollReveal](https://github.com/jlmakes/scrollreveal)
It is great for exactly what it sounds like.... Revealing when a user has scrolled to that section of the page.

Crazy right? haha

![ScrollReveal](https://camo.githubusercontent.com/bcba2683fa4ffc9961ff5e350c14a8d433f2df8a/68747470733a2f2f7363726f6c6c72657665616c6a732e6f72672f6173736574732f7363726f6c6c72657665616c2d7265706f2d6865616465722e706e67){: .centImg}
